title: Persian Loanwords in English
description: From paradise to pajamas, uncover the Persian origins of many beautiful English words!

questions.question: The word 'paradise' comes from the Old Persian 'pairidaeza.' What did it originally describe?
Which English word for a type of checkered board game comes from the Persian 'shah mat,' meaning 'the king is dead'?
The word 'bazaar' comes from Persian. What does it mean?
Which English word for a type of candy or sweet comes from the Persian 'qand' (cane sugar)?
The word 'khaki' passed through Hindi but originates from the Persian 'khak.' What does 'khak' mean?
Which English word for a traveling group crossing a desert comes from the Persian 'karwan'?
The word 'jasmine' enters English from Persian through Arabic. What is the Persian word?
Which word for a type of fabric with a distinctive woven pattern comes from the Persian city of Isfahan?
The word 'scarlet' may derive from the Persian 'saqerlat.' What did it originally refer to?
Which English word for a legendary bird that rises from its ashes likely has Persian roots through the word 'phoenix' and the Persian mythical bird?
The word 'pistachio' comes from the Persian 'pesteh.' Persia (modern Iran) is known for being what in relation to pistachios?
options: The only growers of wild pistachios
One of the world's largest producers
The inventors of pistachio ice cream
The first to export them to Europe

questions.question: Which word for a governor or local ruler used historically in parts of Asia comes from the Persian 'khan'?
The word 'spinach' likely traces back to the Persian 'aspanakh.' How did spinach reach Europe?
options: Through Arab traders from Persia to Spain
Through the Silk Road to China and then Europe

questions.question: Which English word for a decorative headband or crown comes from the Persian 'diadem' tradition?
The word 'azure' (sky blue) likely comes from the Persian 'lazhward.' What did 'lazhward' originally refer to?
